intro: Tithymalus arboreus, commonly known as the tree tithymale, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The plant features finely divided, lance-shaped leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its roots are known for their medicinal properties, containing compounds with potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Tithymalus arboreus is valued in traditional medicine and horticulture for its ornamental and therapeutic uses.
